results.title: On borrowed time: Bruce Ellison
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implication of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Bruce Ellison who has muscular dystrophy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia

results.title: Judy Maddigan
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Judy Maddigan was the first woman Deputy Speaker and was the first woman to be appointed the Speaker of The Legislative Assembly in Victoria in 2003. Maddigan has a strong commitment to community and was elected as a Member of Parliament to represent the Electoral District of Essendon in the Legislative Assembly in 1996. During her time as speaker Maddigan implemented many changes in the 150 year old parliament to improve the lives of workers and also public accessibility. She is a librarian at heart and is currently the Member for Essendon.

results.title: My wife, my horse and myself
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A History of British art”.
The traditional 18th century style, portraits of dogs, horses and family was the province of British artists; their aristocratic clients bought their ‘real art’ in Italy. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

results.title: North and south
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A History of British art”.
Episode two of ‘A History of British art’ looks at the brilliant, mad excessiveness of the Elizabethan visual imagination, in architecture, painting, gardening and language. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

results.title: Dreams and hammers
results.creator_credit: Paul Tickell, Tanya Seghatchian and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A History of British art”.
Episode one of ‘A History of British art’ looks at two extraordinary, forgotten legacies at the heart of the British art tradition: the lost tradition of Catholic medieval art, and the tradition of post-Reformation iconoclasm- an entire culture that was devoted to destroying art. Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

Written and presented by Andrew Graham-Dixon.

results.title: Dur-e Dara
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.
results.description: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.
description_for_label: Dur-e Dara has a long and accomplished career in the food industry and is the first woman President of the Restaurant and Caterers Association of Victoria. Dara is Convenor of the Victorian Women’s Trust; Vice-President of Philanthropy Australia; and board member of the Victorian Wineries Tourism Council and Business Matrix Victoria. She is Director of the Melbourne International Chamber Music Competition, and serves on the advisory boards of the Women’s Reference Group of the Victorian Equal Opportunity Commission; William Angliss College; RMIT School of Tourism and Hospitality; and the Swinburne School of Hospitality and Tourism.

results.title: A Wall of Silence
results.creator_credit: James Ricketson, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fair Go”.
One of a 7 part series which examines the impact of mental and physical disability on individual Australians and their families. They demonstrate the practical implications of coping with a disability in daily life at home, in the work place, at school and in the community. Presented from the viewpoint of the disabled person. This program is about Patricia Quinn-Boas who contracted spinal meningitis and is now almost completely deaf as a result. Editor, Sarah Bennett; camera, Tony Wilson.

results.title: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.
results.description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.
description_for_label: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.
